text:
Had our lunch on a weekday. Upon arrival, a few staffs assist and ask how many persons in Mandarin, and I answered 2 pax. I choose my seat near the aisle walkway cos its a better view. One staff, Chinese national lady came up to me to ask order but i said to wait cos im waiting for my friend from Japan. Once my friend arrive, we ordered our meals. We ask the drinks to be send 1st but it came 15 mins later. Service was unfriendly, and in fact its only 2 of us in the restaurant hahaha.

I love the Butter Prawns as it is the best! None in Newton’s can do like this. Its cook to perfection. No burnt taste!

Today’s chili crab taste below average and abit steep for their price ($100 fr 1 kg) i prefer their black pepper crab which taste much better.

Prawn paste wings as usual, delicious and juicy. Hotplate beef was super soft and good to eat while its hot. Juicy and tender, well marinated.

I hope the taste of chili crab will be improve abit in future and service staffs more FRIENDLIER and approachable .

We paid for the service and foods!

We had a wonderful meal at Ban Leong Wah Hoe! The black pepper crab was the highlight of our meal – the crab was fresh and the sauce was perfectly spiced. We also enjoyed the drunken prawns, which were tender and flavorful. The assam fish head was a good blend of sour and spicy.

This place always helped me satisfy my craving for black pepper crab.

Prawn paste fried chicken winglets are very nice.

Drunken prawns are also very good as the prawns are fresh.
Chef cooks very fast. Also good for takeaway. Fish and prawns are fresh. My uncle who is allergic to prawns ate one drunken prawn and was okay - this means they were cooked fresh.

This meal had very dish being perfectly pleasing. Their HarChong Kai as aways was yummy, kids loved it. Amazingly large wings. Crab dishes was good. First time trying garlic steamed crab and chilli crab as my guest wanted these flavours. I usually have black pepper. The taste for the crabs were pleasing. Chilli crab had more tomato flavours. The next best was the lala, power. Rice and the lala sauce was something I enjoy.
